common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with backup restoration, dependency installation, and sidebar functionality. Backup restoration fails midway, dependency installation gets stuck on "Retry Step", and the sidebar has display issues and pro account features are unavailable despite being logged in.  Check logs for errors, reinstall dependencies, and ensure the Pieces app and extensions are updated to the latest versions. Contact support if issues persist.

* Pieces OS Version 4.3.1

common_issues.title: Pieces connectivity and installation issues across platforms
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty installing and connecting Pieces extensions and applications, primarily on Windows. Issues include the VS Code extension failing to install or load, browser extensions (Chrome, Edge) unable to connect to Pieces OS, and the Pieces sidebar not saving error logs or reflecting Pro account upgrades.  Connectivity problems may be related to VPN usage. Further investigation into installation processes and network configurations is needed.

related_issues.title: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension
related_issues.text: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension. I have installed the extension from VSC, installed all the dependencies multiple times and never able to sign in, never able to launch Pieces from within VSC. I have the desktop running and installed and initialised every time, it makes no difference. I have even added the extension to web browsers and both work flawlessly. See screen shot below. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS
related_issues.text: Pieces extension for Chrome & edge cannot connect to pieces OS ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Web Extension, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Even if the VPN for the browser plugin is turned off, and the virtual network card and global proxy for the desktop VPN are turned on, it is still not possible to connect the browser, including the edge and Chrome pieces plugins, to the pieces OS. PS: My pieces OS and pieces for developers are both installed in sequence on Microsoft Store. - They work well in other aspects. - I have been using them for about 7 days. - I am in Chinese Mainland, thus a heavy VPN user. - Pieces OS has been upgraded to Pro. common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs and UI Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with the Pieces desktop application on Windows, including unintended selection behavior (potentially related to shift/mouse click lock), inability to collapse code blocks, and sidebar issues such as error logs not saving and pro settings not applying despite being logged in.  The reported Pieces OS versions range from 12.2.1 to 12.2.2 and desktop application version 4.3.1 and 4.3.4.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and solutions.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with the Pieces desktop app, primarily on Windows, including large markdown blocks in Copilot responses making scrolling difficult, inability to collapse code blocks, and problems with the Pieces sidebar.  Versions 12.2.1 and 12.2.2 are mentioned.  Additional issues include problems saving error logs and Pro account features not working despite being logged in.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and extension connection issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting difficulties connecting Pieces extensions (Obsidian, Chrome, Edge) to Pieces OS. Problems include Obsidian extension not detecting the Pieces port, browser extensions failing to connect even with VPN configurations, and sidebar login/pro features not working.  Check Pieces OS version, port settings (default changed to 39300), firewall/VPN settings, and ensure Pieces OS and extensions are on the same network.

related_issues.title: Pieces extension for Obsidian using port 1000 but Pieces OS now listening port 39300
related_issues.text:
Pieces extension for Obsidian using port 1000 but Pieces OS now listening port 39300
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Obsidian

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS Version: 12.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I installed Obsidian and added the Pieces extension. The chat works ok, but within Obsidian when I highlight text and right click to send to Pieces it fails. Checking inside Obsidian the Pieces setup it says Pieces port not detected, and does not allow me to set port for Pieces OS within Obsidian.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving sidebar issues across platforms (Windows, macOS, web, and extensions) as they impact core functionality and Pro user experience.
Investigate and address Pieces OS and Desktop application installation and connectivity problems on Windows, focusing on dependency resolution, backup restoration, and VS Code extension installation.
Improve communication regarding port changes (e.g., from 1000 to 39300) and their impact on extension connectivity, particularly for Obsidian.
Address UI/UX issues in the Pieces desktop application, including unintended selection behavior, code block collapsing, and large markdown blocks in Copilot responses.
Investigate and fix the root cause of the "Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model" message appearing in various bug reports.
